trigger.name: Auto Increment Control is disabled
trigger.description: It is recommended to use Auto Increment Control of Galera Cluster.

trigger.name: Causal Reads is enabled
trigger.description: Causal reads has some performance impacts. You should only use it if you really need it. For example in automated Read/Write splitting.

trigger.name: Cluster Configuration has changed
trigger.description: Cluster Configuration ID has changed. This typically means that one node has left or joined the Cluster. You should investigate for the reason.

trigger.name: Cluster is slowed down due to slave lag
trigger.description: Replication is paused from time to time. This means Cluster is slowed due to slave lag. Improve this situation by increasing wsrep_slave_threads and dropping slow nodes out of the Cluster.

trigger.name: Cluster node status
trigger.description: Cluster node status is not Primary. This could mean that the Cluster is partitioned or you met a split-brain condition. You should investigate.

trigger.name: Cluster size is different from expected
trigger.description: Cluster size is different from what is expected. If you have a 2+1 Cluster or a Cluster consisting of more than 4 nodes you have to adapt the Trigger!

trigger.name: Node is not ready
trigger.description: Node is not ready. It cannot accept SQL node right now. Check why.

trigger.name: Too little Slave Threads
trigger.description: More transactions might be applied in parallel than configured in wsrep_slave_threads.

graph.name: Galera Cluster slow down due to Slave lag
